The 4 Best AI Podcasts for Beginners: A No-Jargon Guide

My curated guide to understanding AI — from absolute basics to breaking news

Kenji

15

Lost in the whirlwind of weekly AI announcements from tech giants? I was too, until these four podcasts transformed my daily commute into an AI learning journey.

Between OpenAI’s latest releases, Microsoft’s innovations, and Anthropic’s breakthroughs, staying current with AI developments can feel overwhelming. As someone who struggled to keep pace, I’ve discovered that the right podcasts can turn mundane moments — like morning commutes and lunch breaks — into valuable learning opportunities.

Here are the four shows that have most shaped my understanding of AI, from fundamentals to cutting-edge developments:

Hard Fork

Hosted by: Kevin Roose and Casey Newton
Where to listen: YouTube, Spotify, Apple Podcasts

My gateway into AI understanding started here. Hard Fork feels like having two tech-savvy friends break down the week’s AI news over coffee. Their Friday episodes expertly translate complex developments into digestible insights, making it my perfect entry point into the AI world. What sets them apart is their ability to explain not just what’s happening but why it matters for our future.

Lex Fridman Podcast

Hosted by Lex Fridman
Where to listen: YouTube, Spotify, Apple Podcasts

Don’t let Lex’s occasionally robotic delivery fool you — his conversations with AI researchers, scientists, and philosophers are deeply human and thought-provoking. While some episodes discuss technical depths, Lex excels at exploring AI’s broader implications for humanity. His genuine curiosity about everything from machine learning to consciousness makes complex topics accessible.

Training Data

Hosted by Sonya Huang, Pat Grady, and Sequoia Capital Partners
Where to listen: YouTube, Spotify

Training Data Podcast offers a unique perspective on AI’s real-world applications. What I appreciate most is their focus on practical implications — how AI is transforming different industries and what it means for business leaders and practitioners alike. Their discussions with AI builders and researchers provide invaluable insights into where the technology is headed.

Google DeepMind Podcast

Where to listen: YouTube

I initially avoided this one, fearing it would be too technical. I couldn’t have been more wrong. Their episodes build knowledge progressively, with researchers explaining complex concepts with remarkable clarity. Their series on AI ethics particularly helped me understand not just how AI works, but its broader societal impact.

Takeaway

The barrier to entering the AI space has never been lower, and these podcasts provide the perfect starting point. Whether you’re looking to understand AI for professional growth or personal interest, these shows offer valuable insights without requiring a technical background.

Note: I listen to these podcasts during my commute and lunch breaks, and they’re all available free of charge on their respective platforms. Episode lengths vary from 30 minutes to over two hours.
